tournament.name: Philippines Super Series 2016 - PQ#3 (Pacita Laguna, Philippines)

decks.notes: This deck revolves around utilizing Animar, Soul of Elements as the commander to efficiently cast creatures and combo off to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a variety of low-cost creatures and mana accelerants to quickly build up a board presence and generate mana. It also includes key combo pieces such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Zealous Conscripts to create infinite creature combos for a win condition. The deck's consistency and explosiveness are further enhanced by cards like Birthing Pod, Survival of the Fittest, and Sylvan Library to tutor for key pieces and draw cards. Overall, the strategy focuses on utilizing Animar's ability to reduce the cost of creature spells to create a powerful and fast-paced combo deck.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage while utilizing Keranos, God of Storms as the commander. The deck includes various disruptive spells like Negate, Remand, and Mana Leak to control the opponent's actions. It also has powerful card draw spells such as Treasure Cruise and Ancestral Vision to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of versatile cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Venser, Shaper Savant allows for additional control over the battlefield. The deck aims to stall the game and slowly grind out an advantage through efficient spells and powerful threats, eventually overwhelming the opponent's resources and securing a victory.

The key concept of this deck is to ramp up quickly with mana-producing creatures and land ramp spells in order to generate a large amount of mana early on. This mana is used to play explosive threats like Titania, Protector of Argoth, Primeval Titan, and Craterhoof Behemoth to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a large number of powerful creatures. The deck also has ways to protect its key creatures with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Krosan Grip and Beast Within. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent and quickly closing out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The theme of this deck revolves around controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, bouncing their permanents, and manipulating the top of their library. Vendilion Clique acts as the commander, providing additional disruption for the opponent's strategy. The main deck includes a wide variety of counterspells and bounce spells to maintain control over the game. The deck also includes powerful card draw options like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dig Through Time to ensure consistency. The inclusion of cards like Proteus Staff and Tunnel Vision allows for unique win conditions, while cards like Treachery and Vedalken Shackles provide additional ways to gain advantages over opponents. Ultimately, the goal is to stall and disrupt opponents until you can establish a dominant position on the battlefield.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game using various spells and abilities, while ramping up mana production to be able to cast powerful cards quickly. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells to disrupt opponents' strategies. Cards like Maelstrom Wanderer, Primeval Titan, and Wurmcoil Engine provide strong threats that can quickly close out the game. Additionally, the deck includes card advantage engines like Sylvan Library, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Treasure Cruise to maintain a steady stream of resources. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure smooth color fixing and ramp capabilities, allowing the deck to consistently cast its powerful spells.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to cast powerful creatures, disrupt opponents' strategies, and win the game through aggressive attacks. With Radha, Heir to Keld as the commander, the deck includes cards like Rofellos, Llanowar Emissary, Primeval Titan, and Craterhoof Behemoth to generate massive amounts of mana and buff creatures. It also includes disruptive cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Ravaging Horde to disrupt opponents' mana bases and slow them down. The deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with large creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining a strong mana advantage to stay ahead in the game.
